greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1/phi = phi - 1.
comment: Edge length of a regular decagon with unit circumradius. - _Stanislav Sykora_, May 07 2014

The value a+0i is the only invariant point of the complex-plane endomorphism M(z)=sqrt(2-sqrt(2+z)), and also its unique attractor, with the iterations converging exponentially from any starting complex value. Hence the infinite radical formula. - _Stanislav Sykora_, Apr 29 2016
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Aziz El Kacimi, Des triangles dorés, Images des Mathématiques, CNRS, 2016 (in French).
program: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=(sqrt(5)-1)/2; d=0; for (n=0, 20000, x=(x-d)*10; d=floor(x); write("b094214.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Apr 19 2009
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, May 27 2004
